forumNotes.author: wrayal
forumNotes.content:
Hi everyone,  

I have a rather ambitious project in mind, and was wondering if anyone here could help me? I'm planning on building a USB stick with quite a few features. (incidentally, I'm going to take notes on this online for anyone who might find it useful).   

But there is one trick I quite fancied that I'm not entirely sure about: I was going to put bootable versions of 2K, XP, windows 7 and Mac OSX on the USB stick (Yep, there's enough space - using 32gb corsair). I currently have a computer with XP, ubuntu \& OSX installed sharing a home folder (on a separate partition in fact) using HFS+ and [http://www.mediafour...ducts/macdrive/](http://www.mediafour.com/products/macdrive/ "External link"). I quite wanted to do the same thing on my USB Stick; I think I can do the same thing myself for the OSX partition, but could I for example use this method for producing XP on a stick:  

[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=7466](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7466 "External link")  

And then have the home folder for my user on a separate (HFS) partition as I do on my laptop? The idea was to use the "Format-it-\&-Boot-it" method, putting XP on my third partition or whatever, and simply have all my useful data on the first partition, which I shall use as my 'my documents' folder.  

(Also, I have seen mentions that one can simply install 2k to a USB drive and boot from it; is this truly possible?)  

Many thanks,  

Wrayal

forumNotes.author: online
forumNotes.content:
Just read, and just a preliminary remark: please note that if you want to share an existing folder on your 1st UFD-partition then it should have an hardcoded path (presumably in the registry), but your 1st partition could be change its drive letter under different machines (and/or with different drives).  
For this specific issue it will result (very) useful USBDLM (freeware) service [USB Drive Letter Manager](http://www.uwe-sieber.de/usbdlm_e.html "External link") that definitely set your (choosed) 1st USB-drive letter under any configuration.  
Let me know about your further questions/issues about my tutorial: although I have no experience with Win7 and MacOSX I can say that with "Multiple XP" from your UFD what you want should be feasable.  
The "standard" suggestion is to proceed step-by-step starting from easier/sequential stuff until the job-completion: the first one should be to successfully boot from your UFD (I assume that you already succeed).  
By the way, I've just noticed that all the screenshots in my mentioned thread are not displayed due to the hosting-server [http://www.hostanyimage.com/](http://www.hostanyimage.com/ "External link") hacking incident (I will retrieve those screenshots somewhere on my PC), but I can confirm that all described is smoothly working.  
So, start your project well and see how it behaves.

forumNotes.author: wrayal
forumNotes.content:
Thank you; this is exactly what I had expected the problem might be, but I had not previously come across USBDLM. I'll keep you updated with how it's going!  

Wrayal
